trial_identification.studytitle: Using Exercise Bands to Provide Physical Activity for People with Diabetes and Poor Mobility
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Effect of Using Exercise Bands to Provide Physical Activity for People with Diabetes and Poor Mobility

interventions.interventions: The resistance training program comprised four upper body and three lower body exercises using exercise bands, for 30 minutes/day for 4 months. The resistance exercises performed were chest press, seated back rows, leg abductions, leg extension, seated leg press, triceps extensions, and biceps curls. Leg abduction and leg extension were performed using body weight as resistance.
interventions.comparator: No specific intervention was administered to the control subjects. They were advised to perform their usual activities and take their usual medication.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The amount of glycosylated hemoglobin in blood measured by HbA1c

secondaryOutcome.outcome: anthropometry: body mass index, waist and hip circumference
Medical Outcomes Study 36 Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) to assess quality of life

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: physically sedentary due to co-morbidities stable type 2 diabetes

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a randomised controlled trial of a home-based resistance training program using resistance exercise bands, for people with type 2 diabetes who are limited in their ability to perform aerobic exercise due to other co-morbidities.
